course_format: Duration of the course is 32-40 academic hours. (Usually 4-5 full days or twice as many half-days).
The course includes approximately 40% hands on lab work.
language: The course can be given either in Hebrew or English with slides and materials in English.
objectives: Analyzing data is critical for many people even if their core job is something else. In this course you'll get the tools to take data provided in some well known format, e.g. Excel files, CSV files etc. and analyze them.

In the recent years Python and the SciPy libraries became the de-facto standard for data analysis, both for its price, the available breadth of solutions, and the general usability of the language. Python has long passed both Matlab and R in its popularity among practitioners.
In this course we'll learn about two of the most basic libraries: NumPy and Pandas, and several other, related libraries that will help you answer some of the questions about your data.
prerequisites: Basic background in Python: Understanding basic data types: int, float, string, list, dictionary. Being able to use if-statement, loops, and functions. Being able to install and use 3rd party libraries.
Taking the Python Beginner course and having some practice beyond the exercises will cover the prerequisites.
